transcription.text: Long after the credits roll on a film or television series, the characters might live on in our hearts and minds. They can also live on physically, in our homes and offices, as collectibles that pay homage to our passions. That can be in the form of Felix The Cat, a black and white cartoon from the silent film era, or One-Punch Man, a viral hero from a cult Japanese web comic turned anime. Figurines sometimes become more famous that the original screen character, like Margot Robbie's Harley Quinn from Suicide Squad (2016) who became a pop cultural icon thanks to her own spin-off film Birds of Prey.
